prototype.commodities.tests
Interface TechnicalTestInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
TechnicalTestAbstract
public interface TechnicalTestInterface

The TechnicalTestInterface is a standard interface for all of the technical tests. All classes that extend this interface must contain the following 2 constructors: Test() - Used for retrieving the name of the test ONLY! Test(commodities.dataaccess.Contract) - For all other accesses. This is required since the getName() method must be included in every class but is a static name that must also be used to populate the Test menu.

Author:
J.R. Titko

MIN_SUCCESS_RATIO

public static final double MIN_SUCCESS_RATIO

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Retrieve the name of the test. This name will be the english style name that will appear in the menu and as a header for the graph.

graphResults

public void graphResults()
This method will depict the results of the test. Although this will typically be in the form of a line graph, the graph can appear in any appropriate format. The location to draw the graph in will depend on each test. If the graph should be overlayed on the price graph, the test will have to register with the price graph. If it should be put in its own space, then the statistical graph manager will have to be used.

stopGraphResults

public void stopGraphResults()
Stop graphing this test.

optimizeTest

public void optimizeTest()
Perform an optimization of the test to determine the most profitable combination(s) of parameters to use with the test.

getRecommendation

public Recommendation getRecommendation(int testId,
                                        java.util.Date date)
Retrieve the recommendation resulting from the test for the specified date.

Parameters:
testId - the id of the test in the test table
date - the date to get the recommendation for
Returns:
the recommendation

public int makeRecommendation(java.util.Date date,
                              StatsAbstract stats)
Make a recommendation based on the stats data.

Parameters:
date - the date the recommendation is for
Returns:
a recommendation based on this test
